block.p: Nicole Irene Johnson, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fontain M. Johnson of Santa Claus, Ind., was married yesterday to Richard McGill Murphy, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard W. Murphy of New York. The Rev. Shari Bledsoe performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church in Cold Spring Harbor, N.Y.

Mrs. Murphy, 31, is a regional marketing manager in New York with Bidcom, a company that provides Internet services to the construction and design industries. She received a bachelor's degree and a master's in architecture from the University of Michigan. Her father is the general manager of the Corn Island Shipyard in Grandview, Ind.

Nicole Irene Johnson, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fontain M. Johnson of Santa Claus, Ind., was married yesterday to Richard McGill Murphy, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard W. Murphy of New York. The Rev. Shari Bledsoe performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church in Cold Spring Harbor, N.Y.

Mrs. Murphy, 31, is a regional marketing manager in New York with Bidcom, a company that provides Internet services to the construction and design industries. She received a bachelor's degree and a master's in architecture from the University of Michigan. Her father is the general manager of the Corn Island Shipyard in Grandview, Ind.

Mr. Murphy, 35, is the editorial director of the Committee to Protect Journalists in New York and the owner of WalledCity Media, a film and concert production company. He graduated magna cum laude from Harvard, was a Fulbright scholar in Pakistan from 1992 to 1994 and received a doctorate in social anthropology from Oxford.

His father, a former ambassador to Syria, retired from the State Department as the assistant secretary of state for Near Eastern and South Asian affairs. He is a senior fellow for the Middle East at the Council on Foreign Relations in New York and a consultant on the region.
